summary: Parent workflow remains stuck in Running state when child workflow fails with WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError, preventing the parent from exiting even after child completes and is restarted.
userImpact: Workflows get stuck indefinitely when attempting to spawn child workflows with duplicate IDs, requiring manual intervention to recover.
rootCause: WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError is thrown as Error instead of TemporalFailure, causing the workflow task to fail without properly failing the workflow execution.
proposedFix: Make WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError extend TemporalFailure so it fails the workflow execution instead of just the task.
resolutionDetails: WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError was changed to extend TemporalFailure to properly fail the workflow instead of the workflow task.
keyQuote: WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError should extend TemporalFailure and fail the workflow.
